item.title: Data Analytics Architect
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Data Analytics Architect

Job Description

RBC is a digitally-enabled relationship bank. We strive to engage our customers when, how and where it’s most convenient and to provide a highly-personalized experience. We also collaborate broadly with innovative business and technology partners to create a platform and ecosystem that can bring even more value to our customers. We care deeply about the success of our customers and communities.

We’re looking for an experienced solution architect who is passionate about our mission to join the RBC Digital team. We want vocal futurists that can advocate their vision, who will be excited about creative problem-solving as part of a cross-functional team with customer focus and will strive for the best end-user experience in addition to having the drive and desire to keep learning the latest architecture developments, standards and techniques.

The primary focus of this position is to provide technology and architectural leadership with respect to the design and delivery of highly-scalable customer data and insights solutions leveraging machine learning (ML) and artificial intelligence (AI) platforms.

This work will support development and delivery of information-intensive initiatives based on common practices for multiple complex projects.


What will you do?

  • Collaborate with business leaders to determine how to best apply technology to enable growth and success (e.g. scalable domain-driven solutions, operational reporting, SRE practices)
  • Provide architectural strategic thinking, information solutions, and input into roadmaps to drive delivery
  • Ensure architectural compliance of solutions and introduce recommendations for changes to reference model(s) when needed.
  • Maintain a plan to address gaps between current and target state architectures
  • Participate in \'reuse, buy and build\' decisions.
  • Understand potential impacts of proposed solutions on other systems, processes and/or projects
  • Articulate and document designs, considering trade-offs, costs, and benefits
  • Develop ongoing knowledge of current and emerging technologies
  • Identify new and emerging solutions, assess relevance and potential value to the organization, and present findings to teammates and management.
  • Participate in day-to-day execution of the architecture strategy
  • Develop blueprints and conduct design reviews to ensure architectural compliance of solutions.
  • Work across multiple projects and systems to develop, communicate, and mentor others on solution design, implementation and operation patterns and best practices

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • Background in data architecture, analytics, and cloud native solutions
  • Experience with analysis techniques and measurement tools to continuously build valuable insights and business recommendations.
  • Strategic mindset with strong change management, continuous improvement and transformation skills
  • Strong technical skills in application development (data pipelines, services, streaming platforms)
  • Knowledge of identity and data access management and security best practices
  • Working knowledge in data acquisition, data storage & computational patterns with industry standard tools
  • Experience supporting mission-critical applications in production
  • Software engineering skills with distributed computing background and proven experience in delivering large-scale data platforms.
  • Good understanding of data fabric/mesh concepts and semantic layers

Nice to have:

  • Business or product leadership experience
  • Hands-on working experience with cloud native solution such as SnowFlake, DataBricks, Azure Data Factory, AWS Glue/Lamba, RedShift, Azure DW.
  • Experience with next generation solution delivery on technologies such as Python, Kafka, Spark, Apigee, Jenkins; container solutions including Docker/Kubernetes; and private cloud platforms such as Openshift (OCP) or Pivotal (PCF)
  • Exposure to building and deploying predictive and prescriptive analytics models using any of the following: Python SciKit, R and Pytorch.
  • Experience with Salesforce (CRM), Salesforce Marketing Cloud (SFMC) and/or Palintir Foundry

What’s in it for you? 

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

  • Member of the front-end chapter, which provides training, events, and other opportunities for learning. You will also have an opportunity to share your work and experience with your peers

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • A world-class training program in financial services

  • Flexible work/life balance options​

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

Job Summary

item.title: Associate, Client Data Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate, Client Data Analytics

Job Description

  • Provide key management reporting and metrics as they pertain to defined goals, objects and their critical success factors.
  • Monitor the metrics from the risk and control framework and ensure that the ongoing health of the processes are monitored; ensure sustainable remedial action when issues are identified.
  • Solicit and consolidate inputs from various business partners for preparation of materials presented in management and governance forums.
  • Walk stakeholders through requirements and manages expectations regarding scope of work.
  • Maintains and updates data as needed to support working group processes and reporting.
  • Analyze and prepare complex cross-functional business requirements and process flows, perform gap analysis between as-is and to-be processes, and make recommendations on areas for continual process improvement.
  • Establish and support controls and procedures to review, assess and prioritize these requirements for incorporation into tool and process designs.
  • Gather and clarify business process issues and requirements/ user stories and acceptance criteria through working group sessions.
  • Ensure traceability of requirements to deliverables.
  • Ensure data is consistently maintained to agreed operational and regulatory standards throughout the client lifecycle.
  • Proactively identify operational risks/control deficiencies in the business and opportunities to improve the team & client experience.
  • Create, maintain & monitor an inventory of data & key controls showing ownership, frequency, KRIs, KPIs and SLA’s across the client lifecycle.
  • Assist with the development and maintenance of the application code and user interfaces.
  • Assist in the review and analysis of the user requests, and implementation of both minor and major enhancements.
  • Conduct QA on reports and data produced by Data Analytics.

Job Summary

Associate, Client Data Analytic will play a key role in collection of key management reporting and metrics as they pertain to defined goals, objects and their critical success factors. In addition to gathering risk and performance data, the associate is responsible for gathering and validating business requirements for Client Data Analytics deliverables.

item.title: Senior Analyst, Data Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Analyst, Data Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As a Senior Analyst, you will be responsible for ensuring the accuracy and completeness of the data in Client Repository by leveraging advanced analytics techniques, and for providing insight into client data through reporting and analytics.

What will you do?

  • Support complex data query requests to provide insight into the coverage and nature of client reference data
  • Be responsible for large scale multi-way comparisons of Client data against various internal and external sources to identify trends and to measure overall data quality
  • Develop and implement reporting and data visualization dashboards to articulate trends and data quality measurements
  • Develop monitoring to proactively identify data quality gaps
  • Assess data requirements of new consumers and project initiatives to determine where Client Repository data is fit for purpose, and where gaps exist
  • Support the root cause analysis of data issues relating to client data, and perform complex remediation requiring advanced pattern recognition and machine learning
  • Identify and coordinate system and process enhancements and improvements

What you need to succeed?

  • Completion of an applicable university degree and/or relevant professional designation.
  • A minimum of two years of experience in Python, R and or other programming languages.
  • Advanced Excel Skills
    • Analyze large data sets using pivot tables and pivot reporting
    • Ability to write and create advanced formulas using VLOOKUP, Arrays, Index and Match functions; debug and audit
    • Build macros using VBA (Visual Basic for Applications)
    • Ability to structure and present data for reporting using conditional formatting, tables and charting
  • Intermediate SQL skills
    • Understanding and usage of SQL keywords, data types, constraints, pivots, sub queries, logical and comparison operators, and advanced joins (inner, outer) and unions
    • Understanding and usage of update and insertion statements and syntax for altering and creating structures
    • Can generate complex data reports using GROUP BY and aggregate functions
    • Understands SQL concepts of foreign keys, transactions, triggers, and stored procedures
  • Excellent communication skills – written and oral
  • Strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities 
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Flexible work/life balance options

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same.  Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

Il est possible qu’ils aient à présenter une preuve vaccinale. Des mesures raisonnables d’adaptation sont offertes lorsque la loi l’exige

item.title: Manager, Reporting & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Reporting & Analytics

Job Description

  • The Manager, Reporting & Analytics will work within Operations to develop, design, implement and manage executive reporting that supports Data Centre Infrastructure & Strategy (DCIS) strategic priorities. In addition, the incumbent will also guide and shape strategic choices of the Senior Management team by building out the reporting and analytic ecosystem, delivering ad-hoc analytics and be a subject matter data expert.
  • Drive business results by the design, development and production of insightful Executive reporting that aligns with, and supports DCIS strategic priorities.
  • Leverage financial acumen to synthesize and distil key information to enable faster Senior Management decision making and assists in the establishment of action plans to maximize business performance.
  • Provide expert support and analyses around Apptio deep dive requests resulting from stakeholder enquiries. Sourcing relevant data, performing in-depth analysis and presenting actionable insights to stakeholders in a timely and effective manner.
  • Deliver complete, accurate and timely reporting of contracts, financials and audit & risk activities to enable the business to meet their short and long term goals.
  • Interact with senior leadership to understand their objectives in order to continue to evolve and maximize effectiveness and align reporting and analytics to meet those objectives.
  • Investigate industry trends and organization knowledge to provide alternative reporting approaches/solutions (ex. dashboards, graphical visualizations) that will drive performance to improve insights and analytics across Operations
  • Review and leverage internal and external data/information to provide insights and context around impactful/actionable/controllable business performance opportunities through the use of key performance indicators

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.title: Senior Manager CRM Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager CRM Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

RBC is hiring an exciting Senior Manager, CRM Analytics role. In this role, you will work closely with members of CRM Analytics team and collaborate with various partners including Information Technology, Product groups and Marketing partners across Personal and Commercial Banking focusing on Client Voice analytics developing and implementing solutions that deliver value-added and insightful information to assist in driving profitability and customer experience.

What will you do?

  • Perform text analytics supporting the Lines of Business in meeting their financial and strategic imperatives and providing value for clients
  • Develop and validate statistical models to ascertain the likelihood of specific event or sentiment
  • Generate pertinent marketing leads and collaborate with partners to drive campaign executions
  • Automate and scale the data extraction and strategy application processes to meet business and client needs
  • Explore and identify various data sources to ascertain value and suitability of the data
  • Develop and enhance infrastructure to integrate and ingest the latest data
  • Provide analytical support for other functions within the CRM Analytics team developing and presenting insights and recommendations to continuously improve on current client-centric strategies

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have:

  • Proficient technical skills including SQL, SAS and Python
  • Demonstrated experience with text analytics and statistical model development
  • Sound business acumen and strong analytical, communication and presentation skills
  • Strong problem solving skills and ability to conceptualize strategy
  • Demonstrated ability to work well collaboratively in a cross function environment as well as independently with initiative taking ownership

Nice-to-have:

  • Master’s degree in quantitative discipline
  • Experience in financial services industry with broad understanding of marketing, product management, sales, finance, pricing and risk management

item.title: Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As a Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics, you will work closely with Digital Platform Product Owners, LOB Product Owners, Marketing and Sales teams, and Senior Management to structure analyses, uncover analytic insights, develop net new data assets, build dashboards and model data that will enable data-driven decisions.

In this role you will be responsible for supporting the end-to-end implementation of the analytics lifecycle - data collection, deep dive insight analytics, reporting and presentations.

You will provide objective, value-added insights and analysis to enable product owners to make strategic data-driven decisions. The person in this role will build critical understanding of RBCs products and the associated client behaviours to help deliver business value. The delivery of business value in this role comes from a combination of knowledge transfer to key stakeholders and the provisioning of data services and tests to client facing applications. 

What will you do?

  • Insights and Analytics:

    • Execute analytics plans on large data sets representing the behaviors, demographics and product attribute of prospects and clients. 

    • Use a variety of analytical methods (descriptive, diagnostic and predictive) such as causal inference, time series analysis, and hypothesis testing to find actionable insights

    • Develop and test hypotheses on data and data models

    • Based on evidence, make recommendations to leadership and stakeholders to support strategies and drive decisions

  • Data Collection/Ingestions/Acquisition:

    • Collaborate with data developers, DevOps, data engineers and cloud engineers to implement new data collection/ingestion/acquisition

    • Support business stakeholders in identifying needs for additional data acquisitions, and coordinate plans to orchestrate data acquisitions

    • Find, clean and structure data

    • Develop templates and systems for repeatable processes

  • Digital Product Reporting and Presentations:

    • Support the creation of Business Intelligence reporting that can be automated using reporting tools

    • Define, communicate and enforce reporting and analytics standards, policies and data governance

    • Help construct presentations in story format

    • Deliver clear, concise and timely reports and presentations identifying trends, issues and opportunities 

  • Stakeholder Consultancy:

    • Support relationships with key business stakeholders to develop, execute and monitor complex insights and analytical solutions to business problems using a variety of analytical approaches and methodologies.

    • Digest complex problems and organize into achievable milestones. Manages stakeholder expectations and keeps them up-to-date with project statuses.

    • Apply expertise and think creatively to address unique or ambiguous situations and to find solutions to problems that can be complex and non-routine 

What do you need to succeed? 

Must-have

  • 5+ years\' experience in related digital product development, marketing analyst or data mining role

  • Proven analytics and problem solving skills

  • Strong drive and desire to understand relationship of organizational components

  • BA/BSc or above in mathematics, economics, statistics, computer science or related quantitative field

  • Advanced experience with SQL, Python, or Scala

  • Knowledge of advanced digital analytics methodologies such as experimentation and testing, competitive analysis, surveys and market research.

  • Strong team player with track record of collaboration and experience working as part of an agile team

Nice-to-have

  • Experience with Spark, Scala, Hive, Python is a preferred

  • Good understanding of AWS Big Data services such as Amazon S3, EMR and Glue

  • Experienced with Jupyter Notebooks, IntelliJ, Visual Studio Code other notebook environments

  • Experience working in Unix/Linux environments

  • Experience working as part of an agile team using Github and JIRA

  • Experience with digital data collection tools such as Google Analytics

  • Knowledgeable in data modeling, data orchestration and data pipeline 

What’s in it for you?

  • We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • A world-class training program in financial services

  • Flexible work/life balance options

  • Opportunities to do challenging work

  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities         

  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients

  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.title: Associate Director, Market Risk Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate Director, Market Risk Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Group Risk Management (GRM) provides independent and effective on-site monitoring, controlling, and reporting on the nature and extent of all material market risk on the RBC London Trading Floor – ensuring implementation of and compliance with risk management policies and procedures.

We are looking for someone to manage the development and strategic rollout of the reporting infrastructure for Structured Rates and Global Equities businesses. The incumbent will have strong problem solving, analytical and communication skills – and a track-record of delivering infrastructure changes by devising solutions and liaising with key stakeholders towards project completion.

You will have previous coding experience in Python, VBA, and SQL. You will be able to write tactical scripts where needed, whilst working with key stakeholders to drive strategic change. Hands on experience with Tableau (or similar) is required and  should ideally have a basic understanding of financial products and the main risk factors within the interest rate and equity businesses.  

What will you do?

  • Develop indepth knowledge of the current and strategic reporting infrastructure state
  • Propose, build, and develop tactical and strategic enhancements to the reporting infrastructure
  • Repurpose and rebuild the existing VBA-based reports to the strategic model/infrastructure
  • Enhance Tableau-based reports, and optimise existing reports
  • Co-ordinate project plans, and work with key IT and Risk Management stakeholders to drive deliverables to completion
  • Automate various daily tasks involved in the current reporting infrastructure, including implementation of control frameworks and best-practise checks
  • Provide support to the Risk Managers on day to day running of risk reports
  • Regularly update and clearly communicate progress and milestones with GRM management/users

What do you need to succeed?

 Must-have

  • Strong leadership skills and vision ; proven record of leading a team/project and delivering value-added results
  • Hands on experience working on large datasets and databases
  • Ability to understand and clearly communicated around highly complicated reporting infrastructure dependencies related to books of complex derivatives portfolios
  • Proficient in VBA/Python/SQL
  • Hands-on experience of Tableau
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills ; is able to articulate ideas, thought processes, and recommendations confidently and rationally to senior audiences
  • Relevant experience working with Group Risk Management/Trading at a top-tier financial company
  • Good understanding of the day-to-day responsibilities of Market Risk, and daily risk reporting
  • Preferable knowledge of derivatives and greeks for interest rate and equity option products, Stress testing and scenario analysis and value-at-Risk measurement

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best - progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper.  We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses, flexible benefits and competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Opportunities to work with the best in the field
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible working options fully supported.

Job Summary

Group Risk Management (GRM) provides independent and effective on-site monitoring, controlling, and reporting on the nature and extent of all material market risk on the RBC London Trading Floor – ensuring implementation of and compliance with risk management policies and procedures.

We are looking for someone to manage the development and strategic rollout of the reporting infrastructure for Structured Rates and Global Equities businessses. The incumbent will have strong problem solving, analytical and communication skills – and a track-record of delivering infrastructure changes by devising solutions and liaising with key stakeholders towards project completion.

The person will have previous coding experience in Python, VBA, and SQL. The person should be able to write tactical scripts where needed, whilst working with key stakeholders to drive strategic change. Hands on experience with Tableau (or similar) is required. The person should ideally have a basic understanding of financial products and the main risk factors within the interest rate and equity businesses.

item.title: Senior Manager Pricing and Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager Pricing and Analytics

Job Description

Pricing

  • Develop pricing strategies backed by data driven insights and competitor analyses.
  • Implement end-to-end pricing strategies that include pricing proposals / memos, sales partner engagements, IT requirements and QA/PIV.
  • Work closely with PM&CS and Finance partners to ensure pricing assumptions are regularly reviewed, and challenged when necessary, in order for RBC to remain competitive.
  • Proactively engage in post implementation verification of all pricing changes.
  • Recommend pricing changes directly to Director, Senior Director, and VP in AF N.O.

Analytics

  • Own and perform regular analysis of pricing strategy impacts to ensure they are in line with profitability objectives.
  • Perform frequent market deep-dives and provide competitor insights in order for RBC to remain competitive.  This includes using RBC and third party data to identify deterioration in KPI’s (market share, look share and efficiencies).  Analyse results and provide recommendations to the Director of Pricing & Analytics.
  • Perform deep-dives into the auto finance portfolio to identify early trends and behaviours of both customers and dealers.
  • Proactively seek out and identify potential reporting gaps, new sources of data and recommend solutions.

Monitoring  & Tool Development

  • Develop monitoring tools that measure the success of pricing strategies that will also serve as an ‘always on’ PIV.
  • Enhance new origination and portfolio reporting through the use of leading edge analytics, methods and tools for the early detection of opportunities, trends and anomalies.  Continuously research and develop new methodologies and tools to enhance reporting.
  • Develop and improve tools/models used to monitor the auto finance portfolio

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.
RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

Job Summary

A Senior Manager of Pricing and Analytics is responsible for the development and end-to-end implementation of pricing strategies that directly impacts RBC’s market share, portfolio balance and P&L. Actionable insights and recommendations provided to senior leadership with a focus on profitability, competitive landscape and risk. The Senior Manager participates in preparing senior leadership presentations and discussions, enabling the business to make informed decisions regarding the profitability and risk profile of the portfolio. The employee is expected to have strong business acumen, communication and analytical skills and assists in construction and monitoring of the retail portfolio.

item.title: Sr. Director, AI and Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Sr. Director, AI and Analytics

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?
As the Head of AI, Data Science and Analytics, you will hold a lead role focused on driving technical and innovation capabilities in AI and Analytics space. 
An ideal candidate should have superb analytical, technical, business and communication skills to be able to work with technology leaders to define and prioritize key operational excellence imperatives. The successful candidate will be a proven analytics leader who is comfortable with ambiguity, demonstrates strong attention to detail, and thrives in a fast-paced environment.
A candidate will have deep technical knowledge and experience in applied AI, Data Science and Analytics space, data platforms and knowledge of the MLOps practices and tools combined with experience leading technical teams in matrix and product-centric organization. 
financial and people resource guidance.

What will you do?

We are looking for someone to lead and grow a talented team of data science and data engineering professional to achieve strategic outcomes in the areas of AIOPS and Data analytics. This candidate will develop people, form strong working partnerships with T&O technology leaders, plan and execute AI and analytics roadmaps, formulate analytical strategies for solving RBC infrastructure problems, and develop strategies to scale the impact of data across TI.

In this role you will

  • Attract the best AI, data science and data engineering talent and make TI synonymous with innovation, analytical excellence, and agility.

  • Partner with senior T&O leaders to develop data-driven strategies to drive operational excellence of infrastructure and applications with RBC

  • Deliver insights to help shape strategy across a wide spectrum of application and technology infrastructure areas, including: Cloud, Distributed Hosting, Networking,  End User Compute, and Middleware Platforms

  • Lead data research and development of AI/analytics solutions to improve:  End user experience, Cost Forecasting, Resource Forecasting, Change Management, Problem Management,  Incident Reduction, and MTTR reductions

  • Deliver Data Products necessary to enable Operational/SRE Practices across RBC

  • Oversee planning and execution of analytics data infrastructure roadmap

  • Provide guidance and thought-leadership on analytical best practices to team members and T&O partners

  • Translate analytic insights into concrete, actionable recommendations for TI operational or TI product improvement

What do you need to succeed?

 Must Have:

  • 6+ years of experience in data field and software development

  • 5+ years of experience managing teams

  • 5+ years of experience in design and building scalable data platforms and data solutions

  • Drive the interaction with internal and organizational partners to define, design, and develop solutions to AI, analytics and AIOPS

  • Agile way of working (Scrum, Kanban, SafeAgile)

  • Strong knowledge of design, development, and implementation experience utilizing data science methodologies (CRISP-DM).

  • Strong knowledge of the data science/data engineering toolchain (e.g. MLfLow, Jypiter notebook, DataIKU, Azure MLOps, etc.)

  • Applied knowledge of traditional, private and public cloud data platforms (AWS, Azure and SaaS).

  • Financial planning and management

  • Working knowledge of ITSM processes and general knowledge infrastructure technology stacks (Network, Storage, Compute, etc.)

 Nice to Have:

  • Understanding of SRE practices

  • Observability and monitoring for infrastructure and applications technologies

  • DevOps practices and tools (Jenkins CI/CD, GitHub, etc.)

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing agile team

  • A world-class training program in financial services

  • Opportunities to tackle challenging innovative work

  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities

item.title: Director, Product Owner, Data & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Director, Product Owner, Data & Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Opportunity to lead two growing and successful Data Service products: the Event Engine and PATH. 

The Enterprise Event Engine (Events and Transactions Service) enables action from data by offering a centralized view of all client, process and application events.  Events are standardized and streamed in real-time to support data-driven decision making, process automation and an improved customer experience.


PATH is a journey analytics platform that connects and analyzes process performance from millions of data points across systems and channels to uncover opportunities to improve client experience and operational efficiency

What will you do?

  • Clearly define and document “what” needs to be built including identifying the prioritized feature set and dependencies, with a focus on the 3-6 month time horizon.

  • Working directly with Sr. Product Managers, Business partners and DNA leadership to understand business strategies and use cases (requirements), ensuring product features and roadmap are aligned to business needs and delivering business value

  • Responsible for the creation and maintenance of the product roadmap (features) and implementation plans and successful execution against such plans.

  • Facilitate Agile processes (Stand-ups, Sprint planning, Sprint Retro, Backlog refinement, Sprint Review), and ensure Jira/ Confluence are up to date.

  • Lead the technical requirements gathering, consulting with internal stakeholders

  • Support the positioning of any new capabilities delivered, documentation and collateral for effective communication with partners and Executives

  • Support the Product Manager with the tracking and gathering of ongoing metrics related to adoption and usage

  • Support the development of architectural and design principles and standards to improve performance, capacity, resiliency and scalability of your product(s) to ensure safety and soundness

  • Ensure proper data governance and management is in place with data steward and data owners; creating the necessary PIAs and other privacy/governance/risk documents

  • Complete monthly Business Review Document (BRD). Perform product demo’s as needed and provide updates and supporting material for key meetings/ presentations. 

  • Complete monthly Business Review Document (BRD), and other key documents, in alignment and partnership with Product Management

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • 5+ years proven track record of successful delivery leading products, programs or projects

  • Experience working with Agile software development 

  • Strong communication skills- written and verbal

  • Strong prioritization skills

  • Strong collaboration skills

  • Undergrad degree

Nice-to-have

  • Familiarity with platform, software, analytics, business intelligence technology

  • Financial Services  Industry experience

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper.   • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies

item.title: Associate Director - Climate Risk Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate Director - Climate Risk Analytics

Job Description

  • Work in a collaborative and diverse team environment analyzing environmental & social risk issues, including climate change and developing solutions to address those risks
  • Support the design of methodologies to measure, monitor and manage environmental & social risk;
  • Develop and enhance documentation of methodologies to measure, monitor and manage environmental & social risks (e.g. financed emissions);
  • Liaise with internal and external partners on assurance and review of environmental & social risk methodologies;
  • Identify opportunities and develop recommendations to improve environmental & social risk data processes;
  • Provide transparency and generate insights of the impacts on measurement of climate risk due to external (e.g. methodologies being refined) and internal (e.g. improvement of data) factors;
  • Support the development and presentation of materials for RBC executives and RBC Board of Directors;
  • Assist in the advancement of RBC’s capabilities in measuring financed emissions and delivering carbon accounting insights across the enterprise;
  • Drive enhancement of E&S report contents, controls and processes to improve efficiency and effectiveness (e.g. automation, peer benchmarking, authoritative data sourcing, reconciliation, etc.)

Must Haves

  • Degree in a discipline such as business, sustainability, engineering, math, environmental science or other relevant area
  • 5+ years experience designing methodologies, documenting processes and controls
  • Experience developing presentations and visualizations senior executives (e.g. PowerPoint)
  • Familiarity with climate reporting frameworks such as the GHG Protocol, PCAF, TCFD, CDP etc.
  • Commitment to quality and accuracy with a high level of attention to detail
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Job Summary

The purpose of this job is to support the advancement of the bank’s environmental and social risk data management, analysis and disclosure capabilities and the integration of environmental & social risk data into our risk management framework.

item.description:

Job Title

Lead Developer Data Protection and Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The data protection team is at the forefront of delivering actionable insider threat and analytics services. Using data science practices tied to web and analytics services it helps highlight actionable events for ongoing investigations.

As the lead developer, you will be accountable for extending and enhancing current application services while working closely with product owners to develop and link together various components with a focus on overall fidelity of data models, optimization, product design and delivering enhancements as part of current managed web analytics services. This opportunity is suitable for someone who is skilled in web application development, motivated, someone who enjoy working on a variety of problems and enhancements, someone who works well in a multi-disciplinary team as well as working independently on key tasks.

If you want to innovate and be part of a big picture strategic delivery with a direct impact on organization change this is the placement for you!

What will you do?

  • Delivering new design and development specifications based on customer requirements, while adhering to standard procedures and techniques.
  • Creating test transactions and running tests to find errors and revise application programs.
  • Participating in post-implementation reviews of application development content and processes; continually working to create a learning environment by sharing about the participation process with others.
  • Supporting the implementation of application programs; fixing any existing or new bugs.
  • Design, Develop and enhance current web services
  • Help design, implementing and optimized UI functions
  • Collaborate within the team and stakeholders to enhance and expand current solutions

What do you need to succeed?
Must-have

  • BS/MS in Computer Science or related area or equivalent experience
  • 3-5 years of professional full stack development
  • 3+ years with experience of working with Python/Java/HTML/CSS/SQL
  • Ability to understand software requirements based on program specification
  • Demonstrated experience with building web application frameworks like flask
  • Strong knowledge of web design, testing phases and working with data science
  • Understanding of software development lifecycle and experience with API
  • Experience of development in Cloud environment
  • Excellent analytical skills and problem solving attitude
  • Experience with relational databases(MSSQL, MySQL)

Nice to have

  • Experience with machine learning and statistical techniques, testing/validation, visualizing data, test results and assess model performance
  • Experience with analytics, anomaly detection, model refinement and efficacy
  • Experience with big data technologies – Hadoop, NoSQL/SQL databases, parallel processing techniques, and graph technologies
  • Experience in building backend system with Python, Flask
  • Experience with CI/CD pipelines
  • Knowledge of DevOps and strong debugging skills
  • Experience with Git and process automation
  • Experience in UI/UX Design

What’s in it for you?
 

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. item.title: Associate Director, Capital Analytics & Business Solutions
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate Director, Capital Analytics & Business Solutions

Job Description

  • Lead execution of complex analytics on large datasets to deliver capital optimization through better detection & remediation of upstream data quality issues and business rules in capital applications
  • Responsible for collecting and maintaining prioritized backlog of optimization ideas through facilitation and consultation across the measurement, reporting, optimization, data and policy teams
  • Lead efforts to design, architect, develop and deliver technical solutions to business problems in the area of business data analytics and insights utilizing approved tools and patterns within the bank
  • Responsible for identifying new opportunities for automation and maintaining prioritized ideas backlog
  • Lead development and delivery of small to mid-scale automation solutions to business problems within the capital team using various technology stacks
  • Responsible for existing automation solutions maintenance and controls
  • Lead efforts to develop more robust and consistent technical and business documentation for capital data and systems including lineage, dictionaries, visuals, rules matrices, models and narratives
  • Support efforts to improve data controls environment for capital systems including change controls, security, privacy, testing, data quality, exception handling and system robustness

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have  

  • BA/BSc degree specializing in any combination of Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Finance/Accounting or related fields is required
  • Mature team management and leadership skills
  • Experience in building analytical solutions using modern big data infrastructure
  • Broad experience in performing complex data analytics in specialized domains such as credit risk, capital, liquidity, financial and regulatory reporting within a financial institution
  • Well-developed domain specific data knowledge including positional data underpinning the balance sheet of a bank or similar financial institutions
  • Strong technical coding skills in modern scripting, query and programming languages with heavy data and quick solution automation focus

Nice-to-have   

  • RBC businesses, systems, and sufficient capital data flow understanding
  • Basel Capital Adequacy Reporting (BCAR) knowledge
  • Ability to make sound decisions despite uncertainty and under pressure, always learn
  • Promote new ideas and new thinking to manage team and workflows

Job Summary

As Associate Director of Capital Analytics & Business Solutions, you will play a key role in capital optimization initiatives and providing insightful analytics to help drive higher returns on allocated capital.

This is a unique opportunity to shape the execution of key components of our strategy to build Capital Domain’s strong data analytics, decision insights, data management and business solutions capabilities.

You will work with massive amounts of data processed through our next-gen data infrastructure under-pinning the bank’s entire balance sheet, portfolios, business lines, products, segments and the related complex business rules and transformations to measure and report regulatory capital across all risk buckets.

item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Sr. Manager, Analytics Implementation & Innovation (Mobile)

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

In this role, you will be responsible for strategically planning and managing successful deployment of the analytics capabilities within the mobile banking channel. You will prioritize, coordinate, develop, lead, communicate and execute activities to ensure an industry leading digital analytics practice within RBC.

What will you do?

  • Lead, manage and establish standards for digital analytics solutions within the mobile channels

  • Establish strong working relationships across business units and platforms to build influence and impact with key business partners.

  • Collaborate with groups to define and achieve deliverables and ensure initiatives are effectively integrated into RBC procedures and processes.

  • Work with stakeholders to understand their business objectives and translate into analytics integration, technology strategy and requirements

  • Manage the implementation of multiple concurrent initiatives of varying complexity in a time efficient manner.  Monitor and control activities according to plan.  

  • Continuously identify potential issues, conflicts, and risks.  Analyze, mitigate and escalate where appropriate

  • Collaborate and contribute on cross-functional data initiatives and manage the effective implementation of assigned deliverables.

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • 3+ years mobile app development, design, and/or architecture experience in native, hybrid or full-stack web applications

  • Experience with one or more of Swift, Ajax, REST, JSON, Angular.js, Node.js, REACT

  • Experience with third-party libraries and APIs

  • Familiarity with mobile software lifecycle including application development, debugging, performance, security and deployment

  • Has experience in one or more of the following areas: digital analytics, optimization, statistical modeling, consumer insights, and/or marketing analytics

  • Demonstrated ability in written and oral communication skills along with strong presentation skills. Ability to determine the information and communication needs of the stakeholders and project.

Nice to have:

  • Experience with Firebase, Google Analytics and Tag Management tool

  • SCRUM and AGILE development practices

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. Supports the development and maintenance of scalable data collection within the digital channel that supply big data in forms needed for ingestion, modeling, data science, reporting and other relevant activities.

item.title: Director, Capital Markets Benchmarking Analytics and Strategy
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Director, Capital Markets Benchmarking Analytics and Strategy

Job Description

Primary Responsibilities

  • Lead as the core contact for internal global Capital Markets benchmarking operative, responsible for primary and secondary peer group reporting, analysis and analytics for key executive level stakeholders not limited to Group Executives, Capital Markets operating committee (inclusive of CEO and CFO) and trading desk heads
  • Apply sector-specific expertise and knowledge to analyze business-level competitive positioning using quantitative modelling and deep-dive research
  • Partner and facilitate rapport with front-office trading and banking teams to accumulate and apply competitive peer knowledge to develop action-oriented analysis and recommendations to drive executive discussion and decisions
  • Build upon infrastructure to lever large internal and external data sources (via analytics tools), not limited to market data applications such as Bloomberg, Capital IQ, Morningstar, as well as external insights from Dealogic; Coalition; Refinitive
  • Navigate and cut through complexity of CM peer strategy and micro-level transactions to dissect key findings and insights amongst subject matter not limited to balance sheet optimization; business model (revenue stream) analysis; investment bank compensation; and cost management.  Build upon comparable financial and non-financial KPIs (levering CM Platform team infrastructure) to evaluate peer vs. peer performance
  • Establish both traditional peer reporting model (external peer financial release, investor materials inclusive of investor day presentation, analyst and conferences calls) and output produced via ad hoc mosaic approaches integrated with internal CM business knowledge/expertise/research
  • Utilize and leverage business driver models and forecasting capabilities to drive insights for key business partners
  • Present output and findings to senior leadership (both verbally and through key materials), conveying on key recommendation and insights.  Answer direct front-office and executive inquiries as appropriate
  • Manage team of 3 to 5 professionals in a collaborative, fast pace environment

Must Haves:

  • Bachelor’s degree; with emphasis in finance/accounting or management preferred
  • +5 years of experience in a financial institution or management consulting firm with focus on banking/capital markets
  • Must be advanced with Power Point, Excel, Access, Outlook, Word, Bloomberg, Acrobat, etc.
  • Keen sense of numbers and strong analytical skills with ability to prioritize multiple tasks and handle time-sensitive executive level requests on a continuous basis
  • Excellent leadership and interpersonal skills with the ability to influence stakeholders and mobilize teams to deliver on common goals
  • Innovative, proactive, and persistent in issue resolution

Nice to Have:

  • CPA, CFA or Finance MBA with specialization in capital markets and/or financial institutions
  • Prior experience in equity research; investor relations (within financial institutions); Capital Markets business management; and/or Capital Markets peer benchmarking consulting
  • Existing knowledge/expertise in Capital Markets business and transactions (inclusive of bank structure, risk management concepts, financial markets, and instruments)
  • Working knowledge of Python, R, or other data analytics toolsets.

Job Summary

Key leader within the Capital Markets Platform Performance Management team with responsibility on developing strategic benchmarking output and innovative competitive analytics to advance business leaders initiatives, strategy and knowledge vis a vis external market landscape.

item.title: Senior Manager, Sales Capacity Planning & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Sales Capacity Planning & Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As the sales capacity subject matter expert, leads the end-to-end strategic planning, capacity modelling and forecasting for 5,000+ sales advisors across 1,200 branches nationally within Regional Banking.  Leverages key insights to counsel and guide sales workforce investments and implementations (how many advisors, where to place them, when do they work) ensuring sufficient supply to meet demand. 

Leads sales capacity analytics for numerous strategic initiatives with a primary focus on the Business Advisor and Financial Advisor roles. Develops and enhances models to maximize the ROI of these roles while minimizing client experience impacts. Extensive ongoing sales modelling and analytics are required to determine optimal productivity and capacity requirements for these roles aligned to Distribution and Digital Strategy objectives.

Analyses market opportunity, appointment booking, contacts, transaction volume, client demographics and sales trends, including the impact of unplanned global events (i.e. Covid) and ensures that sales capacity models are always relevant based on most recent data and analytics.  Provides proactive, actionable sales capacity insights on an ongoing basis to numerous stakeholders including executives (i.e. monthly updates for P&CB leadership and National Office), Physical Networks, Role Design, and Regional Capacity Managers.

What will you do?

Sales Workforce Planning, Analytics & Modeling

  • Primary lead for Business Advisor and Financial Advisor role capacity analytics and insights.
  • Lead analyses on sales trends to identify opportunities for optimization and to better forecast future sales needs. Provide capacity optimization recommendations to Regional Banking with insights around sales performance and model health on a regular cadence.
  • Own the continuous calibration of sales capacity model to maintain alignment with role intent and distribution transformations. Partner with Physical Network, Role Design, Scheduling, Capacity Management, and vendor to ensure incremental strategic initiatives and evolving branch operations (e.g., Retail Credit Reinvention, NGS, Physical Networks hours and days of business, new/closed branches, pandemic responses) are incorporated into model and assumptions to enhance model’s forecasting capability. This includes new data, incremental operational risks, and changing branch attributes.
  • Design framework for what-if scenarios to stress-test capacity requirements under various conditions and provide recommendations.
  • Lead annual business planning and forecast 5YO sales workforce capacity.
  • Deliver monthly tactical sales forecasts that feed RBC Sight for branch scheduling.

Sales Workforce Capacity Forecasting and Optimization

  • Lead as subject matter expert (SME) on workforce management methodologies, tools for capacity optimization, and branch scheduling best practices. This includes providing stakeholders with guidance on business requirements, addressing escalations around data, and ensuring model processes are documented and kept up to date.
  • Perform deep-dive analyses on model levers (e.g., market opportunity, appointments, sales trend etc) to identify opportunities to increase market share, efficiency and improve routines. Provide contextual insights to help partners make informed decisions (e.g., branch hours and days of business, FTE requirement projections).
  • Develop, build, run, and continuously enhance reporting as supporting infrastructure for Scheduling and Capacity Management teams to forecast, coach, and implement capacity deployment tactics.
  • Explore and enable new reporting and data visualization platforms to improve stakeholder experience and deliver faster/better insights.

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • 5+ years working with forecast models, including scenario testing to support workforce planning
  • 7+ years of hands-on experience with data presentation and developing recommendations
  • Bachelor\'s degree in relevant discipline. Master\'s preferred
  • Extensive hands-on experience with capacity planning principles and methodologies
  • Demonstrated ability in packaging and presenting insights to a broad range of stakeholders and executives
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to turn data into actionable business insights
  • Strong proficiency in Excel, Pivot Tables and PowerPoint
  • Working knowledge of branch sales environment and protocols and/or previous sales experience

Nice to have:

  • Working knowledge of reporting and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau)
  • Ability to write and run simple to intermediate level queries in SAS, SQL, Python or Alteryx etc
  • Workforce Planning and Capacity Analytics experience

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Customer Insights, Data & Analytics Product Manager (Ownr)

Job Description

RBC Ventures is a new kind of business – one that marries the strength of one of the world’s most trusted and successful financial institutions with a mission to reimagine the role we play in people’s lives – to move RBC ‘beyond banking’. We’re building a world-class organization focused on designing exceptional experiences, exploring new business models and creating exponential value. In 2020, we were named by Fast Company as one of the 100 Best Workplaces for Innovators and we’re looking for team members with the curiosity to explore, the capabilities to build and capacity to help us deliver our mission

What is the opportunity?

Ownr is seeking a talented, experienced and passionate Product Manager focused on customer insights, Data & Analytics to join our growing team. In this role you will work across the business to support and manage the execution of data-related products and projects to help drive our customer understanding and cross-functional capabilities. We are looking for vocal futurists who have a passion for technology and are inspired by the idea of bringing to life product roadmaps that benefit hundreds of thousands of people at a key milestone in their lives.

About Ownr

At Ownr, we have helped thousands of Canadians establish their businesses. As we redefine the entrepreneurship landscape, we take pride in simplifying what it takes to be a business owner. We\'re on a mission to become the leading platform for entrepreneurship in Canada, and it takes an entire team to build something big. So join our team and discover how we can help entrepreneurs make their dreams a reality.

 

What you will do

  • Help set the product vision and strategy for data, analytics, and customer insights
  • Own the translation of business requirements, you will execute to deliver solutions that expand our data and analytics capabilities across multiple portfolios.
  • Design and conduct analyses using various techniques (developing frameworks, building dashboards, segmentation, modelling) to provide value for the stakeholders you support.
  • Responsible for creating and managing quality data products, processes and services to ensure growth and achievement of our business goals.
  • Understand our key drivers, customer use cases, and full user flow impact across all platforms.
  • Create, manage, and maintain KPI\'s to monitor, analyze and improve conversion
  • Lead the product planning and development process through backlog grooming, refinement, and prioritization activities
  • Define and detail User Stories and prioritize team backlogs in accordance to our business drivers.
  • Evaluate and document the requirements for each product feature, articulate these requirements, answer questions and make scope trade-off decisions as needed.
  • Ensure optimal delivery by removing barriers and obstacles that impact performance and develop contingency plans to demonstrate adaptability while supporting continuous learning.
  • Bridge technical, business and creative worlds, engaging with matrixed teams including development, UX/UI design, copy, legal, risk and compliance, creating a collaborative environment while maximizing on business return.
  • Drive internal stakeholders and cross-functional business unit engagements necessary for an optimal on-time launch.
  • Focus on backend functionality as well as user-facing features that make world-class user engaging platforms.

 

Skills you\'ll need to succeed

 Must have

  • Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience in an analytical function (e.g. Business Analytics, Consulting).
  • Experience working as a Product Manager in a SaaS environment.
  • Proven work experience in data product management (growth-stage company experience a plus) and working with agile teams and organizations.
  • Experience translating business requirements to actionable software solutions.
  • In-depth knowledge of agile processes and principles, with the ability to provide direction to the agile team and stakeholders throughout.
  • Extensive experience developing use cases, epics and stories in a clear and concise manner, enabling the engineering team to deliver maximum productivity and value
  • Experience maintaining and prioritizing the backlog in accordance to business and technology drivers.
  • Experience in the planning of product releases and setting expectations for delivery of new functionality.
  • A Proven ability to make hard decisions in a fast-paced environment, while actively identifying and mitigating issues that have an impact on successful completion of goals.
  • Ability to speak to business functions, customers and partners with confidence and professionalism.
  • Commitment to winning as a team.
  • An entrepreneurial & innovative spirit

 

Nice to have

  • Experience with the development process, use of tools like GitHub
  • Experience using analytics tools such as: SQL, Amplitude, and Metabase

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options

 Launching and running a business can be daunting. But, at Ownr, we bring entrepreneurs closer to their dreams.

 

We have helped thousands of Canadians establish their businesses. As we redefine the entrepreneurship landscape, we take pride in simplifying what it takes to be a business owner. Our industry-leading tools, resources, and ongoing support make it as easy as possible for entrepreneurs to start and succeed.

 

VSPRODUCT

RBC Ventures

item.title: Risk Analyst, Global Risk Analytics (Fall 2022 Student)
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Risk Analyst, Global Risk Analytics (Fall 2022 Student)

Job Description

Please note: This posting is for a 4-month Fall 2022 Student placement with a start date of September 2022, and end date of December 2022. In order to be eligible for this 4-month Student position, you must either:

  • Be returning back to school after the work term end-date of December 2022; or

  • If you are not returning back to school (i.e. are graduating in December 2022), you must require the full 4-month work term as a mandatory component to in order to graduate successfully.

Please ensure that you meet these eligibility requirements before applying - candidates who apply but are found to be ineligible are not able to be considered.

What is the opportunity?

Global Risk Analytics (GRA) is the center of expertise for models used in risk measurement of market and counterparty credit risk for trading book. In particular, GRA is the owner of market data that is used to generate various scenarios for VaR/SVaR, potential future exposure (PFE) and stress testing in Capital Markets. Ensuring the quality of data is the foundation of good risk management.

Given the large size of market data (big data), advanced analytics such as machine learning needs to be leveraged.  Machine learning development with big data is highly iterative, including data labeling, model training, deployment and monitoring. If we can build tools and processes that enable high-throughput experimentation, we can make faster progress with various applications such as market data anomaly detection. In addition, alternative less structured data such as traditional and social media news often bring early warning signals for client credit quality monitoring. How to leverage news via machine learning is key to bring values for risk management.

GRA is seeking an individual who is interested in applying machine learning knowledge and programming skill to enhance our market data quality monitoring, as well as sentiment detection from alternative less structured data. The intern student will be working on market data anomaly detection and news sentiment detection and alert. The candidate will learn both machine learning and real business use case.

What will you do?

  • Learn about trading products and risk factors in capital markets

  • Research machine learning techniques with interaction of big data for data anomaly detection.

  • Implement new sentiment detection via natural language processing (NLP).

  • Make presentation to senior people in risk

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Strong programming experience in Python and SQL.

  • Knowledge about machine learning

  • Knowledge about quantitative analytics

  • Ability to communicate technical matters in written and oral forms

  • Team players to collaborate and innovate

Nice-to-have

  • Understand of the big picture regarding how risk function works in banks

  • Knowledge of financial products, especially fixed income and equity products

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Opportunities to do challenging work and make a difference

  • Opportunities to building close relationships

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.
 

We encourage you to apply as soon as possible as we accept applications on a rolling basis, but please note that the formal application deadline is 13th May 2022. Should you be selected to progress, someone from our team will reach out directly to provide instructions on next steps. Otherwise, feel free to check for progress updates by logging in to your RBC profile. If the status has not changed, it denotes the fact that your application is still under review.

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. The successful candidate for this role will be required to be located within Ontario for the duration of the work term. Details regarding the specific virtual, hybrid, and in-office arrangements for this Integrated Learning/ Co-op position are to be discussed with the Hiring Manager.

About RBC
Royal Bank of Canada is Canada’s largest bank, and one of the largest banks in the world, based on market capitalization. We are one of North America’s leading diversified financial services companies, and provide personal and commercial banking, wealth management, insurance, investor services and capital markets products and services on a global basis. We have over 80,000 full- and part-time employees who serve more than 16 million personal, business, public sector and institutional clients through offices in Canada, the U.S. and 37 other countries. For more information, please visit rbc.com.
